description: From Middle English taster; equivalent to taste +â€Ž -er.

entries.meaning: An object in which, or by which, food or drink is tasted, for example a dram cup
Someone who tastes something, especially food, wine etc., for quality.
(zoology) A kind of zooid situated on the polyp-stem of certain Siphonophorae, resembling the feeding zooids, but destitute of mouths.
A sample of something bigger or grander intended for future use
examples: The exhibition was a taster of products set to hit the market.

entries.meaning: A person who is, by genetic makeup, able to taste phenylthiocarbamide
